<h1 align=left style='margin-left:0in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;
mso-list:none;tab-stops:.5in'>Lab # 4 Part 1: Experiments for the 8<sup>th </sup>week<!--[if supportFields]><span
style='mso-element:field-begin'></span> TC "Experiments for the 5th
Week" \f C \l "1" <![endif]--><!--[if supportFields]><span
style='mso-element:field-end'></span><![endif]--></h1>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>These experiments involve
Chapters 4, 6.2 and 6.3.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

normal'><span style='mso-element:field-end'></span></b><![endif]--><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

</span></span><![endif]>Study sock as a traffic generating software package, in
terms of its features and command line options<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo20;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span><![endif]>Study User Datagram Protocol (UDP)<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo20;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span><![endif]>IP fragmentation<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo20;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span><![endif]>TCP and UDP in action: File Transfer Protocol (ftp) and
Trivial File Transfer Protocol (tftp)<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:

</span></b>

<h2><![if !supportLists]>1.1<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span><![endif]>Configuration</h2>

<p class=MsoBodyText style='text-align:justify'>For these experiments we will
be using only two PCs connected via a hub. </p>

<p class=MsoBodyText3 style='margin-right:.5in'>Note: the two PCs are to be on
the same subnet. Change the IP addresses to reflect this single segment
network. <i>host</i> in our notes below refers to the <i>other_machine</i>.</p>

<h2><![if !supportLists]>1.2<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span><![endif]>The Sock Program<!--[if supportFields]><span style='mso-element:
field-begin'></span> TC "5.2	The Sock Program" \f C \l
"2" <![endif]--><!--[if supportFields]><span style='mso-element:field-end'></span><![endif]--></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Exercise 1</u></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Using the following commands,
observe the basic operation of the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock </b>program:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock</b> <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>host</i> <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>echo</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock -s 5555</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;text-indent:.5in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock -i -n3 -w2048 </b><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>host </i><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>9</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Questions #1</u></b>: </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo34;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span><![endif]>Explain the operation of each of the above commands.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;text-indent:3.0pt'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Study the various options
associated with the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock</b> program,
become familiar with its operation. (See appendix C in the Stevens textbook or
look at the sock man page.)</p>

<h2><![if !supportLists]>1.3<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span><![endif]>User Datagram Protocol (UDP)<!--[if supportFields]><span
style='mso-element:field-begin'></span> TC "5.3	User Datagram Protocol
(UDP)" \f C \l "2" <![endif]--><!--[if supportFields]><span
style='mso-element:field-end'></span><![endif]--></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Exercise 2</u></b><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>       </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>While running<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'> tethereal –V –fudp</b>, execute the following command with different
values of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>n</i>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock -u -i -n1 –w<i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>n</i> </b><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>host</i><span
style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>discard</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>-u</b> option is used to generate UDP data instead of TCP data.
Increase the value of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>n</i> (i.e. the
size of the datagram) until fragmentation occurs.<span style='mso-tab-count:
2'>             </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Questions #2</u></b>:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span>Answer
the following questions:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo37;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span><![endif]>What is the maximum value of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>n</i> that can be sent without IP fragmentation? Use <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>netstat -in</b> to find out the maximum
transmission unit. Justify the above two values.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Exercise 3</u></b><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>       </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Capture the data packets
generated by the following command:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock -u -i -n1 -w10000</b> <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>host</i> <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>discard</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Store the window that contains
the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>tethereal –V –fudp </b>output for
further study.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Questions #3</u></b>:<span style="mso-spacerun: yes">  </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo38;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span><![endif]>Explain the output of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>tethereal </b>in terms of the IP header’s fields that are used in
fragmentation.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The textbook says that all the
packets except the first one do not have their UDP headers. How do you verify
this fact from your <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>tethereal </b>output?</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Exercise 4</u></b><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>       </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>While running<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'> tethereal –V –fudp</b>, execute the following command with different
values for n:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock -u -i -n1 -w</b><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>n</i> <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>host</i> <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>discard</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>in order to find out the maximum
size of a UDP datagram that our system in the lab can send or receive, even
with fragmentation.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Questions #4</u></b>: </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:
-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo39;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span><![endif]>What is the maximum size of the user data in a UDP
datagram that the network in the lab can send or receive, even with
fragmentation.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<h2><![if !supportLists]>1.4<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span><![endif]>FTP and TFTP<!--[if supportFields]><span style='mso-element:
field-begin'></span> TC "5.4	FTP and TFTP" \f C \l "2" <![endif]--><!--[if supportFields]><span
style='mso-element:field-end'></span><![endif]--></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>We will study the performance of <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>ftp </b>and<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'> tftp</b> for file transfer between two machines. Two files (<u><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>large.d</span></u> and <u><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>small.d</span></u>) are provided in the
/tftpboot directory. If they are not then do the following to place them there:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>mkdir</b> /tftpboot</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>cp</b>
/usr/lib/libstdc++.so.2.7.2.8 /tftpboot/large.d</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>chmod</b> 777
/tftpboot/large.d</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>cp</b> /etc/services
/tftpboot/small.d</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>chmod</b> 777
/tftpboot/small.d</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Only use the get command for
transferring a file. In the case of FTP, specify the absolute path name for the
file you want to get (e.g., <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>get </b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>/tftpboot/large.d</span>). To use ftp as
root, recall that you may have to edit the /etc/ftpusers file, remove the line
containing root. For tftp you may have to edit the /etc/inetd.conf file to
enable tftp. Uncomment the tftp entry in that file by removing the ‘#’ at the
beginning of the line. You will have to restart inetd (type inetd) or reboot
the PC. Note you also need to set up a /tftpboot directory on <i>other_machine</i>
to copy into.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Exercise 5</u></b><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>       </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Set up either ftp or tftp (note
password for root has been set to “ics156”). In order to compare the transfer
rates of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>ftp</b> and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>tftp</b>, run the following command for
each file transfer program:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

</span></span><![endif]>What did you expect from the given commands? Explain

</span></span><![endif]>If the <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>tethereal
</b>output is different from what you expected, give the reason for the
disagreement.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>Exercise 13</u></b><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>While running <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>tethereal –V </b>for the packets between
two machines, invoke the server with the following commands on host A:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock -i -s -v -r1460 5555</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>On the corresponding client,
execute</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sock -i -n1 -w21900</b><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'> host_A </i><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>5555</b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>What is the window size of the
receiver (i.e., the server in our case)?</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Now, with the <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>-R</b><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>n</i>
option on the receiver side, we can vary the server’s window size. Can you make
a smaller receive window than in the previous case? For example choose: <i>n</i>=2880</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Change the receiver’s window size
(for example, use <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>n</i> =4680, 14600 and
27520). In each case, record how many data segments are transmitted at once
before the sender receives an ACK.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><![if !supportEmptyParas]> <![endif]><o:p></o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>When you change the value of <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>n</i>, how does the number of unacknowledged
data segments change as the transfer progresses? </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Can you find anything in common
among them? </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Explain how flow control works in
this experiment. Observe that when the window size becomes very small (<u>Note</u>:
must be larger than an MSS), flow control kicks in instead of congestion
control.</p>
